cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 395 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Drifting northward, then forecast to turn north-northeast and accelerate northeast – crossing Florida’s Big Bend Thursday, emerging off the Georgia/South Carolina coast Friday, and moving northeast just offshore of the Mid-Atlantic (near the Virginia Capes) on Saturday before heading out to sea.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast between Indian Pass and Cedar Key

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Anclote River FL to Indian Pass FL.  Tropical Storm Watch: Marineland FL to Altamaha Sound GA.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning: Anclote River FL to Walton/Bay County line FL.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf coast of Florida, then the U.S. east coast from Georgia through the Carolinas and into the Mid-Atlantic including coastal Virginia.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible Saturday (10-17% chance of sustained 34-kt winds, 2-4% chance of 50-kt).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding possible, surge heights expected to remain below 3 ft in Virginia.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could bring 2–4 in., locally higher, beginning late Friday night and continuing Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and possible brief tornadoes in outer rainbands.
